# R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
 
library('plotly')
fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
    mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10,color="red"),
  lines = list(size = 10,color="black"),
  fill = 'toself',
  name='Trail'
) 
 
 
library('plotly')
fig <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
    mode = 'lines+markers', marker = list(size = 10),
  fill = 'toself',
  name="Trail01"
)
 
fig <- fig %>%
  layout(
    polar = list(
      hole=0.2,
      radialaxis = list(
        visible = T,
        range = c(0,3),
          angle=90,
        tickangle = 90,
        color = 'grey',
        nticks = 4,
        tickcolor =toRGB('blue'),
        tickfont = list(
               size = 10,
               color = "blue"
             ), 
        ticks = "outside",
        ticklen = 10,
        tickwidth = 3,
        gridcolor = 'red'#color of grid lines
        

      )
    ),
      showlegend = T,
    showline = T
  )

fig <- fig %>% layout(
  title = "Radar Charts in R with Plotly",
  scene = list(
    xaxis = list(title = "Cos"),
    yaxis = list(title = "Sin"),
    zaxis = list(title = "Z")
  ))



  
fig <- fig %>%
  add_trace( r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(0,45,90,135),
  line = list(
    color = "blue"),
  marker = list(
    color = "red",size = 6, symbol = 'square'),
  name="Trail02"
  )
fig


  
fig <- fig %>%
  add_trace( r = c(0,1,2,3),
  theta = c(180,225,270,315),
  line = list(
    color = "blue"),
  marker = list(
    color = "red",size = 6, symbol = 'square'),
  name="Trail02"
  )
fig
 
```

 library('plotly')
 

df <- data.frame( r = c(0,1,2,3,4,3,5,6),
  theta = c(180,225,270,315,180,225,270,315),           
  group = c('A', 'A', 'A', 'A', 'B', 'B', 'B', 'B'),
  size = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 3, 4)
  )

            
 colors_map <- c("blue", "green", "red") 
            

fig <- plot_ly(df,
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  mode ='lines+markers',
  hoverinfo="text",
  marker = list(symbol = 'circle', line = list(width = 2, color = 'lightgrey')),
  r = ~r,
  theta = ~theta,
  color = ~group, 
  colors = colors_map, #Provide a color mapped vector
  size = ~size, 
  sizes = c(100,200), #Provide a range of size.
  text = ~paste('<b>DETAILS </b><br>---------------<br>Radius:', r, '<br>Theta:', theta, '<br>Group:', group, '<br>Size:', size))%>%
  layout(title = 'SAMPLE TITLE',
         showlegend = TRUE,
         polar = list(
           #hole = 0.5,
           radialaxis = list(
             tickfont = list(
               size = 20,
               color = "blue"
             ),
             visible = TRUE,
             tickcolor = toRGB("red"),
             ticks = "outside",
             #ticklen = 15,
             #tickwidth = 20,
             
             range = c(0, max(df$r)),
             rangemode = "tozero",
             angle = 90,
             tickangle = 90,
             #gridcolor = '#FFF', #color of grid lines
             categoryorder = "array",
             categoryarray = c("GroupA", "GroupB", "GroupC", "GroupD") #Not working
           ),
           angularaxis = list(
             tickfont = list(
               size = 12
             ),
             rotation = 90,
             direction = 'clockwise' ,
             categoryarray = c("A", "B", "C", "D") #Not working
           )
         )
  )
ggplotly(fig)
